zbib.about.feature1.paragraph.string: Simply find what you’re looking for in another browser tab and copy the page URL to the ZoteroBib search bar. ZoteroBib can automatically pull in data from newspaper and magazine articles, library catalogs, journal articles, sites like Amazon and Google Books, and much more. You can also paste or type in an ISBN, DOI, PMID, or arXiv ID, or you can search by title.

zbib.about.feature10.paragraph.string: If you want to edit your bibliography on another device, share it with someone else, or switch to another bibliography, you can generate a link to a copy of the current version on zbib.org. Use the link to retrieve your bibliography later.

zbib.about.feature2.paragraph.string: If automatic import doesn’t find what you’re looking for or you’re entering something without a URL or identifier, you can enter the reference information by hand.

zbib.about.feature3.paragraph.string: To rename your bibliography, just click its title. A title can be useful if you’re switching between multiple projects or sharing a bibliography with others.

zbib.about.feature4.paragraph.string: You might need to add or change a few fields after adding an item. Click on a bibliography entry to make manual changes.

zbib.about.feature5.paragraph.string: Click the { deleteIcon } next to a bibliography entry to delete it. To start a new bibliography, click Delete All to remove all entries.

zbib.about.feature6.paragraph.string: Format your bibliography using APA, MLA, Chicago / Turabian, Harvard, or any of the {citationStylesCount, plural, other {#+ other <link>CSL</link> styles} }.

zbib.about.feature7.paragraph.string: As you’re writing, you can quickly generate parenthetical citations or footnotes /endnotes to paste into your document without typing names or dates by hand.

zbib.about.feature8.paragraph.string: When you’re done, you can copy a formatted bibliography to the clipboard and paste it into your document. You can also export HTML to add to a webpage, an RTF document to open in a word processor, or a RIS or BibTeX file to import into a reference manager.

zbib.about.feature9.paragraph.string: ZoteroBib automatically saves your bibliography to your browser’s local storage — you can close the page and return to it anytime. (If you’re using private / incognito mode in your browser, your bibliography will be cleared when you close the window.)

zbib.about.summary.string: ZoteroBib helps you build a bibliography instantly from any computer or device, without creating an account or installing any software. It’s brought to you by the team behind <link>Zotero</link>, the powerful open-source research tool recommended by thousands of universities worldwide, so you can trust it to help you seamlessly add sources and produce perfect bibliographies. If you need to reuse sources across multiple projects or build a shared research library, we recommend using Zotero instead.

zbib.bibliography.emptyLead.string: To add a source, paste or type its URL, ISBN, DOI, PMID, arXiv ID, or title into the search box above

zbib.bibliography.override.string: There is an existing bibliography with {localCitationsCount, plural, one {# entry} other {# entries} } in the editor. If you continue, the existing bibliography will be replaced with this one.

zbib.citePrompt.string: Enter a URL, ISBN, DOI, PMID, arXiv ID, or title

zbib.confirmCase.conversionExample.string: ZoteroBib conversion: Circadian mood variations in twitter content

zbib.confirmCase.explanation.string: The style you’ve selected requires titles to be in sentence case rather than title case. When you use this style, ZoteroBib will convert the titles of entries to sentence case for you, but you’ll need to manually edit some entries to capitalize proper nouns:

zbib.confirmCase.titleCaseExample.string: Title case: Circadian Mood Variations in Twitter Content

zbib.confirmDeleteAll.prompt.string: {bibliographyCount, plural, one {# entry} other {# entries} } will be deleted.

zbib.dialog.confirmAddThisCitation.string: Add this citation to your bibliography?

zbib.error.fetchMetadata.string: Failed to obtain metadata. Please check your connection and try again.

zbib.footer.follow.string: Stay in touch! Follow <link>@zotero</link> on Twitter.

zbib.multipleChoice.prompt.string: Please select a citation from the list

zbib.multipleItems.prompt.string: Please select a citation from the list

zbib.saveToZotero.message.string: Once you’ve installed Zotero and the Zotero Connector, you can export your bibliography to Zotero by clicking the “Save to Zotero” button in your browser’s toolbar.

zbib.styleInstaller.searchPlaceholder.string: Enter three or more characters to search
